summary: A letter from the law firm WilmerHale to the U.S. Attorney's Office, transmitting financial records in response to grand jury subpoenas related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter also formally requests confidential treatment for the produced JPMorgan Chase account documents under FOIA exemptions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the holder of a JPMorgan Chase account for which documentation was produced to the grand jury.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the holder of a JPMorgan Chase account for which documentation was produced to the grand jury.

connections.description: Both are named as individual account holders at JPMorgan Chase, with their account records being produced to the same grand jury investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena to JPMorgan entities
events.description: Grand jury subpoenas issued to JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., Chase Bank USA, N.A., and J.P. Morgan Securities LLC.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena to JP Morgan Chase
events.description: Grand jury subpoena issued to JP Morgan Chase.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena to JP Morgan Chase
events.description: Grand jury subpoena issued to JP Morgan Chase.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena to JPMorgan Chase Bank and affiliates
events.description: Grand jury subpoenas issued to JPMorgan Chase Bank N.A. and all affiliates.

events.title: Document Production and Request
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office requested documents via email, and WilmerHale, on behalf of JPMorgan, produced an encrypted zip file containing account documentation.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: JPMorgan Chase, through its counsel WilmerHale, produced financial account records for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell to a federal grand jury.
The production was in response to a series of grand jury subpoenas issued in August, September, and October of 2019.
The produced records included documents for accounts held by Epstein, Maxwell, ASW Holdings, Inc., and Financial Trust Company, Inc.
JPMorgan formally requested confidential treatment for all produced materials, citing FOIA Exemptions 4 and 7, arguing disclosure would cause competitive harm.
The letter establishes a procedural framework for JPMorgan to be notified and object if any third party requests the documents under FOIA.
